text:
Kinda thought for once, since the prices for every dish is clearly stated, the stall won’t anyhow charge. Unfortunately no. The price of this plate of 2 dishes I ordered without rice should be exactly $3.30. Fella tried to charge me $4.50. After asking him about it, he tried to say it’s because he gave me a bit more meat then proceeds to remove meat from what was already a small portion, then changed the price to be $3.50, insisting it is $3.50 because I didn’t want rice. But rice was clearly stated to be a separate item price on the pricing board. Oh wells…
Taste wise, not bad but can’t stand dishonest cai fan stalls so probably never again ;( unsolicited advice but if you are planning to be dishonest maybe just have the prices up on the board haha…

This cai png or economical rice stall has a large variety of dishes. Food was also freshly prepared. The lemon chicken was quite good of this lot, very tender and juicy. The rest of what you see here are pretty average. Price is also considered reasonable.

This chai ben store serves variety of food. Prices depends what you choose for individual. Last time they used to serve until late nights but after covid19 they end around 8pm.
Overall is a good place to eat
Corner coffeeshop opposite uob bank. Tea quite ok and nice place to chill and have a drink. Orh kee noodles pretty nice, i like the soup
Food taste good. $11 for 1 porridge and 1 rice, two meats and two vege.
